channel.title: What is the difference between mix and mix sq?

item.title: What is the difference between mix and mix sq?
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

The parameters have a different "taper" (how the position relates to the level).
Square scaling is more usable for audio level than linear scaling.
Linear scaling for a level control has little (only 6dB) effect in the top half of the parameter.
Square scaling doubles that to 12dB of attenuation in the top half.
It's not log scale - that would be the same knob travel for a certain number of decibels, but also on mixer desk faders you will see that the number of decibels per centimeter increase near the bottom. Square taper has similar properties.

Read full topic
item.source: What is the difference between mix and mix sq?

item.title: What is the difference between mix and mix sq?
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

From just looking at them I think it is only the scaling of the values that is different.
On the mix when setting is 32 = 0.5... On mix sq it is only 0.25. But what a square gain scale really is(from the description) Johannes probably knows.... I am not sure about it. And couldnt find anything form googling...
